section.name: Analysis
section.definition: Sections of the Analysis type can be used to describe analyses.

section.name: PSTH
section.definition: An Analysis-type section to describe a PSTH.

section.name: PowerSpectrum
section.definition: Properties of this section define the way a power spectrum was calculated.

section.name: Cell
section.definition: Specification of the recorded cell. A cell definition should be a subsection of the Subject section.

section.name: Dataset
section.definition: Names (URLs) and times of recorded data files. Datasets are obtained during a Recording and may belong to different Experiments. Related sections that can be used as subsections, parent sections, or siblings are Stimulus, HardwareSettings, and Experiment.

section.name: Blackrock
section.definition: Information on the Cerebus^TM data acquisition system

section.name: Electrode
section.definition: Properties to describe an electrode.

section.name: Event
section.definition: Section for short annotations that are taken during an experiment to describe certain events.

section.name: EventList
section.definition: Section for grouping short annotations that are taken during an experiment, preparation etc...

section.name: Experiment
section.definition: Specification of an experiment. The Experiment is part of a Project and the recorded data for a specific Experiment are found in Datasets. Possible subsections are, for example, Dataset and Stimulus.

section.name: Behavior
section.definition: Properties for describing an behavioural experiment.

section.name: Electrophysiology
section.definition: Properties for describing an electrophysiological experiment.

section.name: Imaging
section.definition: Properties for describing an imaging experiment ranging from conventional light microscpoy to fMRI.

section.name: Psychophysics
section.definition: Properties for describing an psychophysical experiment.

section.name: HardwareSettings
section.definition: The used values of variable properties of hardware components. There are two sections for describing hardware components: the "HardwareProperties" and the "HardwareSettings" section. While the HardwareProperties describe the fixed properties of the hardware that can not be changed, the HardwareSettings section describes the actual, adjustable, parameters of the hardware that may change with each recording or dataset. For example, the sample rate of an data-acquisition board or the settings of a filter. In each of these two sections there are subsections for each device that correspond to the class of the device like data-acquisition, amplifier, etc. Some properties are common for any type.

section.name: Hardware
section.definition: Fixed properties of hardware components used in the experimental setup. There are two sections for describing hardware components: the "HardwareProperties" and the "HardwareSettings" section. While the HardwareProperties describe the fixed properties of the hardware that can not be changed, the HardwareSettings section describes the actual, adjustable, parameters of the hardware that may change with each recording or dataset. For example, the sample rate of an data-acquisition board or the settings of a filter. In each of these two sections there are subsections for each device that correspond to the class of the device like data-acquisition, amplifier, etc. Some properties are common for any type.

section.name: Amplifier
section.definition: The amplifier section defines elements that can be used to describe amplifier properties and settings.

section.name: Attenuator
section.definition: Settings of the data acquisition system. most settings refer to individual channels the channel number should be given after the property name like DAQ. AISampleRate0 for the sampling rate of the analog input channel 0.

section.name: CameraObjective
section.definition: This section contains properties that describe a camera objective.

section.name: DataAcquisition
section.definition: The hardware section describes the settings of the used hardware. There should be one hardware section for each hardware item that was used.

section.name: Eyetracker
section.definition: Properties of an eyetracker.

section.name: Filter
section.definition: Properties a filter modul for analog signal conditioning.

section.name: Filterset
section.definition: The FilterSet or also FilterCube used in a microscope.

section.name: ImageAcquisition
section.definition: Properties to define an Image acquisition device. This can be a framegrabber, a camera etc.

section.name: Lightsource
section.definition: This section contains keywords to describe the actual settings of a light source used for stimulation or excitation.

section.name: Microscope
section.definition: The Microscope section describes the properties of the used microscope.

section.name: MicroscopeObjective
section.definition: This section contains properties that describe the objective used in a microscope.

section.name: Scanner
section.definition: The Scanner used to scan microscope images.

section.name: StimulusIsolator
section.definition: Properties of a stimulus Isolator device.

section.name: Leaky integrate and fire
section.definition: Section to describe a leaky integrate and fire neuron model.

section.name: perfect integrate and fire
section.definition: Section to describe a perfect integrate and fire model.

section.name: Multi compartment model
section.definition: Section to describe a biophysical model that consists of a number of compartments.

section.name: One compartment model
section.definition: Section to describe a biophysical model that consists of a single compartment.

section.name: Person
section.definition: Information about a person. E.g. as Experimenter, Author, etc.

section.name: Preparation
section.definition: Description of the preparation procedure.

section.name: Project
section.definition: Information about the project.

section.name: Recording
section.definition: During a recording session in a Setup Datasets are obtained from Cells and/or a Subject by using various stimuli (Stimulus section).

section.name: Setup
section.definition: The experimental setup used in the recordings. By using HardwareProperties as a subsection, a very detailed description of the setup can be given.

section.name: Stimulus
section.definition: General description of an applied stimulus. This section is basis of various related sections that specify more specific stimuli.

section.name: DC
section.definition: Property definitions to describe a DC stimulus meaning a constant stimulus e.g. a constant illumination, current etc.

section.name: Grating
section.definition: Property definitions to describe Gabor stimuli.

section.name: Pulse
section.definition: Properties to describe a simple pulse stimulus that starts from and returns to a certain baseline.

section.name: Movie
section.definition: Properties to describe a movie (or image sequence) stimulus.

section.name: Ramp
section.definition: A ramp stimulus may either linearly increase or decrease in amplitude. Starting from a certain start amplitude and reaching with a certain slope the destination amplitude.

section.name: RandomDot
section.definition: Properties to describe a random dot stimulus.

section.name: Sinewave
section.definition: Sawtooth Properties.

section.name: Squarewave
section.definition: A squarewave stimulus was presented. Squarewaves modulate with a certain frequency about the intensity offset.

section.name: Whitenoise
section.definition: Property definitions to describe a white noise stimulus.

section.name: Subject
section.definition: The investigated experimental subject (animal or person). May contain the Cell and Preparation sections as subsections.

section.name: CarmenMini
section.definition: This is a convenience section that lists the terms of the CARMEN MINI (Gibson et al. Nature Precedings, 2009 Version 0.6) and maps them to the odml "standard" terminologies.
